item.title: Starting a Blog
item.description:
Why

Self Expression Encourage reflection Share learnings and ideas Have something to jog memories

Adaptations

Tool Installations

I have the habit of using version managers from work, so instead of installing go directly, I install it from asdf.

asdf plugin add golang https://github.com/asdf-community/asdf-golang.git
asdf install golang 1.23.3

I also added golang 1.23.3 to my $HOME/.tool-versions file. I spent way too long debugging that Hugo was out of date, and switched to 0.140.2 with asdf instead of the apt package

asdf plugin add hugo
asdf install hugo 0.140.2

Different Theme Changes

Sass

Needed to install dart-sass for theme. I didn’t want to edit my $PATH, so I went for the npm route npm install -g sass. Hugo still complained about sass execute permissions, so I added it chmod +rx <node install>/bin/sass That still didn’t work, so I installed Homebrew for Linux to install it.

brew install sass/sass/sass

PostCSS

Had to follow these instructions

Add a .gitignore

I don’t like committing generated items, especially if they’re going to be uploaded elsewhere.

public/
resources/_gen/

Hosting on GitHub Pages instead of Hostinger

Convert the public folder to a submodule

StackOverflow Create the github.io repository Delete the public folder (It’ll get regenerated) Add the GitHub Pages repo as a submodule

git submodule add git@github.com:<username>/<username>.github.io.git public

Learnings

Reiterating that NPM should not be used as a tool package manager when at all possible.
